intro: Pectis filipes, commonly known as the silky pectis, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces showy, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in late summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its leaves are narrow and hairy, giving the plant a distinctive, silvery appearance. Pectis filipes is often found in open grasslands and along riverbanks, where it thrives in full sun and well-drained soil.
